City High's online delivery approach will be extended through the month of May. However, it will look differently than how we finished trimester 2: Please download the entire letter for more details and City High's new online structure. Continue to stay safe and healthy! Best, Dr. Allen LETTER TO PARENTS—Moving Forward April 13, 2020 IMPORTANT PARENT MESSAGE MARCH 27, 2020: Hello City High Parents and Families, As promised, we included their Assignments document per grade and team for each of their courses. We've attached the Assignments document below for every grade, which also includes teacher office hours. Continue to stay safe and healthy! Best, Dr. Allen ASSIGNMENTS CH 9th Grade Assignments_3-30 to 4-3-20 CH 10th Grade Assignments_3-30 to 4-3-20 CH 11th Grade Assignments_3-30 to 4-3-20 CH 12th Grade Assignments_3-30 to 4-3-20 Hello Class of 2023, 2022, 2021, and 2020: We hope that you are doing well and keeping yourself productively busy considering the circumstances. Whether it's listening to your favorite song/artist, reading, exercising, watching a favorite show/movie, and/or doing a kind deed for someone else, try to do something each day that that makes you smile. Again, we miss you and will get through this one day at a time. We have one week of school left in the trimester starting on Monday, March 30th. As promised, attached are document that have compiled all of your assignments per class and per team as well as office hours for your teachers. We will also post this document on our website. I want to give your teachers a shout-out for the time they put into collaboratively developing assignments given the new parameters we're working within of temporarily transitioning to online/remote facilitation of your classes. Feel free to thank them too. Have a good weekend and then let's be ready to start Monday prepared to finish our last week of trimester two strong! Best, Dr. Allen School will be open today, March 27th, from 8:00 a.m. to Noon, for students to pick their laptop and/or charger. Since Governor Wolf's Stay-at-Home order, we received further guidance that allowing students and staff to come on-site to pick up essential educational items is an allowable emergency provision of the order. Students should practice social distancing while on-site. Please also note that this opportunity is not to gather other items or to clean out lockers. That opportunity will be provided at a later date. We will be opening school from 4:00 to 7:30 p.m. THIS EVENING on March 23rd to allow students and staff to pick up laptops and chargers if necessary. Letters & Notifications to Parents, Students and Staff During the Covid-19 Outbreak A chronological listing of all important messages and downloads, as presented during the Covid-19 shutdown. IMPORTANT PARENT MESSAGE APRIL 20, 2020:
We care deeply about our City High student body as well as our teachers and staff that comprise our school community. Please download and read our COVID-19 Continuity of Education Plan for City Charter High School
IMPORTANT PARENT MESSAGE APRIL 13, 2020: Hello City High Parents and Families As we look ahead to the start of trimester 3, we have made some decisions about how we will begin the next trimester in light of Governor Wolf's recent announcement that mandated school closures are being extended through the end of the school year to help minimize the spread of COVID-19 and its impact on our respective communities. City High's online delivery approach will be extended through the month of May. However, it will look differently than how we finished trimester 2: Please download the entire letter for more details and City High's new online structure.
Continue to stay safe and healthy! Best, Dr. Allen
LETTER TO PARENTS—Moving Forward April 13, 2020
IMPORTANT PARENT MESSAGE MARCH 27, 2020:
Hello City High Parents and Families, As promised, we included their Assignments document per grade and team for each of their courses. We’ve attached the Assignments document below for every grade, which also includes teacher office hours. Continue to stay safe and healthy!
Best, Dr. Allen

CH 12th Grade Assignments_3-30 to 4-3-20
Hello Class of 2023, 2022, 2021, and 2020:
We hope that you are doing well and keeping yourself productively busy considering the circumstances. Whether it's listening to your favorite song/artist, reading, exercising, watching a favorite show/movie, and/or doing a kind deed for someone else, try to do something each day that that makes you smile. Again, we miss you and will get through this one day at a time.
We have one week of school left in the trimester starting on Monday, March 30th. As promised, attached are document that have compiled all of your assignments per class and per team as well as office hours for your teachers. We will also post this document on our website. I want to give your teachers a shout-out for the time they put into collaboratively developing assignments given the new parameters we're working within of temporarily transitioning to online/remote facilitation of your classes. Feel free to thank them too.
Have a good weekend and then let's be ready to start Monday prepared to finish our last week of trimester two strong!
Best, Dr. Allen
School will be open today, March 27th, from 8:00 a.m. to Noon, for students to pick their laptop and/or charger. Since Governor Wolf’s Stay-at-Home order, we received further guidance that allowing students and staff to come on-site to pick up essential educational items is an allowable emergency provision of the order. Students should practice social distancing while on-site. Please also note that this opportunity is not to gather other items or to clean out lockers. That opportunity will be provided at a later date.
IMPORTANT PARENT MESSAGE MARCH 23, 2020:
Governor Wolf held a press conference today at 2:00 p.m. that Allegheny County will now be under a ‘Stay at Home’ order beginning at 8:00 p.m. tonight. As a result, we are adjusting our plans for laptop/charger pick-up. We will be opening school from 4:00 to 7:30 p.m. THIS EVENING on March 23rd to allow students and staff to pick up laptops and chargers if necessary.
Please DOWNLOAD for information regarding our Google Classroom platform and tentative return to traditional classrooms!
Respectfully, Dr. Dara Ware Allen CEO and Principal City Charter High School
IMPORTANT PARENT MESSAGE MARCH 16, 2020:
Download City High School Closure Information
Governor Wolf Closes All Pennsylvania Schools for Two Weeks
Hello Everyone: We were just alerted that Governor Wolf just issued a declaration closing all Pennsylvania schools for 10 days starting March 16, 2020
Do your best to stay healthy and care for your loved ones.
Respectfully, Dr. Dara Ware Allen CEO and Principal City Charter High School
IMPORTANT PARENT MESSAGE MARCH 13, 2020: Governor Wolf Closes All Pennsylvania Schools for Two Weeks
Hello Everyone:
We were just alerted that Governor Wolf just issued a declaration closing all Pennsylvania schools for 10 days starting March 16, 2020 (https://www.post-gazette.com/news/education/2020/03/13/Gov-Wolf-closes-all-K-12-schools-in-Pa-for-two-weeks/stories/202003130150). Parents will be contacted with new information as it unfolds through City High's emergency school closing systems and emails, as well as the school website in the coming weeks.
Do your best to stay healthy and care for your loved ones.
Respectfully,
Dara

div.h1: Letters & Notifications to Parents, Students and Staff During the Covid-19 Outbreak

h2.em: A chronological listing of all important messages and downloads, as presented during the Covid-19 shutdown.

div.p: We care deeply about our City High student body as well as our teachers and staff that comprise our school community. Please download and read our COVID-19 Continuity of Education Plan for City Charter High School

p.br:
Hello City High Parents and Families
As we look ahead to the start of trimester 3, we have made some decisions about how we will begin the next trimester in light of Governor Wolf’s recent announcement that mandated school closures are being extended through the end of the school year to help minimize the spread of COVID-19 and its impact on our respective communities. City High’s online delivery approach will be extended through the month of May. However, it will look differently than how we finished trimester 2:
Please download the entire letter for more details and City High’s new online structure.

hr.p:
Continue to stay safe and healthy!
Best, Dr. Allen

div.p:
Hello City High Parents and Families, As promised, we included their Assignments document per grade and team for each of their courses. We’ve attached the Assignments document below for every grade, which also includes teacher office hours.
Continue to stay safe and healthy!

We hope that you are doing well and keeping yourself productively busy considering the circumstances. Whether it’s listening to your favorite song/artist, reading, exercising, watching a favorite show/movie, and/or doing a kind deed for someone else, try to do something each day that that makes you smile. Again, we miss you and will get through this one day at a time.

We have one week of school left in the trimester starting on Monday, March 30th. As promised, attached are document that have compiled all of your assignments per class and per team as well as office hours for your teachers. We will also post this document on our website. I want to give your teachers a shout-out for the time they put into collaboratively developing assignments given the new parameters we’re working within of temporarily transitioning to online/remote facilitation of your classes. Feel free to thank them too.
Have a good weekend and then let’s be ready to start Monday prepared to finish our last week of trimester two strong!

h3.strong:
School will be open today,
March 27th, from 8:00 a.m. to Noon,
for students to pick
their laptop and/or charger.

hr.p:
Since Governor Wolf’s Stay-at-Home order, we received further guidance that allowing
students and staff to come on-site to pick up essential educational items is an allowable
emergency provision of the order. Students should practice social distancing
while on-site. Please also note that this opportunity is not to gather other items or to clean out lockers. That opportunity will be provided at a later date.

Governor Wolf held a press conference today at 2:00 p.m. that Allegheny County will now be under a ‘Stay at Home’ order beginning at 8:00 p.m. tonight. As a result, we are adjusting our plans for laptop/charger pick-up. We will be opening school from 4:00 to 7:30 p.m. THIS EVENING on March 23rd to allow students and staff to pick up laptops and chargers if necessary.

p.em: Please DOWNLOAD for information regarding our Google Classroom platform and tentative return to traditional classrooms!

div.strong: Governor Wolf Closes All Pennsylvania Schools for Two Weeks

hr.div: We were just alerted that Governor Wolf just issued a declaration closing all Pennsylvania schools for 10 days starting March 16, 2020 (https://www.post-gazette.com/news/education/2020/03/13/Gov-Wolf-closes-all-K-12-schools-in-Pa-for-two-weeks/stories/202003130150). Parents will be contacted with new information as it unfolds through City High’s emergency school closing systems and emails, as well as the school website in the coming weeks.
Do your best to stay healthy and care for your loved ones.
